critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving an agreement related to the National Industrial Recovery Act. It pertains to fair competition within the construction industry, specifically painting, paperhanging, and decorating in Denver, Colorado. The document reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. It doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. However, the economic regulation aspect is prominent. The ideological tilt leans liberal due to the interventionist economic policies.
